parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: (a) intrans: I wonder, marvel, (b) trans: I wonder at, admire. From thauma; to wonder; by implication, to admire.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Plural
str2: From ek and histemi; to put out of wits, i.e. Astound, or become astounded, insane.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: (a) I say, speak; I mean, mention, tell, (b) I call, name, especially in the pass., (c) I tell, command.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
No, not. Also ouk, and ouch a primary word; the absolute negative adverb; no or not.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: A prolonged form of an otherwise obsolete verb; to talk, i.e. Utter words.
A Galilean, an inhabitant of Galilee. From Galilaia; Galilean or belonging to Galilea.
